The technology sector is particularly vulnerable to AI-driven layoffs. The rise in unemployment figures tied to AI adoption is contributing to increasing income inequality and regional economic disparities. Government and corporate initiatives are being developed to mitigate the disruptive effects of AI.

articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Michael Burry has taken a $1.1 billion short position against two key players in the artificial intelligence (AI) sector: Nvidia and Palantir. Burry's actions are a warning about the broader economic implications of an AI bubble. A rapid correction could trigger a wider market downturn, impacting investors and the global economy.

articles.title: Shaping Bahrain's digital destiny: MPs to debate national AI strategy
articles.author: The Daily Tribune
articles.summary: Parliament will debate a proposal for a National Artificial Intelligence Strategy on Tuesday. It aims to establish a dedicated AI Centre and build Bahraini expertise to improve public services and drive economic growth in Bahrain. It is also aimed at drawing investment and building Bahrain's expertise in AI.

articles.title: During The AI Journey To AGI There Is Concern That We Will Be Like Frogs In A Slowly Boiling Pot
articles.author: The New York Ledger
articles.summary: In today's column, I examine an intriguing premonition that humankind will be subjected to the proverbial boiling frog theory during our journey from conventional AI to the vaunted attainment of artificial general intelligence (AGI). We are going to get closer and closer to AGI on a gradual stepwise progression.

articles.title: Computer viruses are learning to think. Google confirms that AI is behind attacks that change shape during execution
articles.summary: Google's Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) has issued a warning about the rise of AI-powered malware capable of rewriting its own code in real-time and adapting to defenses. There is a growing black market for illicit AI tools with platforms like Xanthorox offering fully automated ransomware and phishing tools for as little as $200.

articles.title: Government launches global AI contest for women with â‚¹25 lakh prize: How to register and eligibility
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: The Government of India has introduced "AI by HER Global Impact Challenge". The competition aims to support women-led artificial intelligence (AI) initiatives focused on public benefit. The program seeks to promote gender. It is a worldwide competition. It's open to all countries.

articles.title: Elon Musk is obsessed with developing â€˜racy' AI chatbot Ani: Report claims
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Elon Musk's latest obsession is Ani, an artificial intelligence girlfriend created by his AI company xAI. According to the Wall Street Journal, he oversaw the development and design of the chatbot. Ani's adult mode feature has raised questions about its safety.

articles.title: Deepika Padukone recalls being mocked for her voice and accent, now becoming voice of Meta ...
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Deepika Padukone is the new voice of Meta AI across multiple countries. The actor's voice was mocked when she came into the industry and now she is the voice of AI. She believes that her accent may have helped her to get the job.

articles.title: Snap èˆ‡ Perplexity ç°½ç½² 4 å„„ç¾Žå…ƒåˆä½œå”è­°ï¼Œæ•´åˆ Perplexity AI è‡³ Snapchat æå‡æœå°‹åŠŸèƒ½
articles.summary: AI is a social media app created by Evan Spiegel and is called Perplexity AI. It's available on Snapchat, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Tech Telegram. It has a chatbot called YTechhk, which is used to discuss tech topics.

articles.title: 40% Market Crash Coming, Warns Big Investor
articles.author: Archana Kumari
articles.summary: Mark Mobius, founder of Mobius Capital Partners, warns of a major correction looming in the artificial intelligence (AI) sector. He remains bullish on AI's long-term prospects, but warns of the short-term risks. Mobius believes AI companies' valuations have reached excessive levels and could see a decline of up to 40%.

articles.title: 1 Stock-Split Stock to Buy Now -- It Has More Upside Than Palantir Technologies, According to Wall Street
articles.author: Trevor Jennewine
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) is a leader in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning platforms, but the stock trades at an unsustainable valuation. O'Reilly Automotive executed a 15-for-1 stock split in June 2025 and the median target price is $113 per share, which implies 20% upside from the current share price of $94.

articles.title: During The AI Journey To AGI There Is Concern That We Will Be Like Frogs In A Slowly Boiling Pot
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Boiling frog theory predicts that humankind will be subjected to the proverbial boiling frog theory during the journey from conventional AI to the vaunted attainment of artificial general intelligence (AGI). This analysis is part of Forbes column coverage on the latest in AI, including identifying and explaining various AI complexities.

articles.title: AI Deployment: Speed Over Cost for Top Engineers
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Wonder, a food delivery company, and Recursion, a biotech firm, are struggling with the cost and availability of AI infrastructure. The future of AI is likely to be hybrid, with companies balancing on-premises and cloud resources. The development of more efficient model training and deployment techniques will be crucial to unlocking AI's potential.

articles.title: Why Every Leader Should Ask What's The Cost Of Their Own Fear Of AI
articles.author: Dr. Diane Hamilton
articles.summary: Fear of artificial intelligence (AI) limits innovation, collaboration, and curiosity in organizations. Fear of AI often comes from uncertainty and a lack of confidence. Leaders who resist AI because they feel uncertain are not protecting their teams, but limiting them. Fear is an inhibitor of curiosity. When people develop their curiosity, their anxiety drops and confidence grows. People who feel supported in learning new technologies are more engaged at work.

articles.title: Multiple lawsuits accuse ChatGPT of driving people to kill themselves
articles.summary: ChatGPT's creator, OpenAI, is accused of emotionally manipulating its users and fueling AI-induced delusions. The complaints allege that ChatGPT contributed to suicides and mental health crises even among users with no prior mental health issues. The suits were filed Thursday by the Social Media Victims Law Center and the Tech Justice Law Project on behalf of four people, ages 17 to 48, who died by suicide and three people who say their lives were upended by interactions with the AI bot. OpenAI is reviewing the lawsuits.

articles.title: Your next colleague could be an AI agent â€“ report
articles.author: Arabian Business
articles.summary: More than half of global talent leaders plan to add AI agents to their talent management systems.   Â   Ã‚   .   for more than half the world's top talent management companies will use AI agents.  For more information, visit the company's website.

articles.title: Can You Really Talk To The Dead Using AI: Comfort Or Illusion?
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is being used to preserve the voices and stories of the dead. Text-based chatbots that mimic loved ones and voice avatars that let you "speak" with the dead are just some of the examples of AI-powered chatbots.

articles.title: Families blame GPT-4o for deaths, sue OpenAI over â€˜rushed' release
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Seven families in the US have filed lawsuits against OpenAI. Four of the lawsuits involve alleged suicides linked to ChatGPT. The remaining three claim that the chatbot reinforced harmful. OpenAI released its GPT-4o model before it was ready and without sufficient safety measures.

articles.title: OpenAI faces 7 lawsuits claiming ChatGPT drove people to suicide, delusions
articles.summary: The OpenAI logo appears on a mobile phone in front of a screen showing part of the company website in a photo taken on Nov. 21, 2023 in New York. Subscribers can sign up for as low as 36 cents per day to continue viewing our website.

articles.title: Can you really talk to dead using AI? We tried out 'deathbots' so you don't have to
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to preserve the voices and stories of the dead. There is a growing digital afterlife industry that promises to make memory interactive and, in some cases, eternal. The research was recently published in Memory, Mind & Media and explored what happens when remembering the dead is left to the AI.

articles.title: VAST Data, CoreWeave Sign $1.17B Deal to Advance AI Infrastructure
articles.summary: VAST Data has announced a landmark $1.17 billion commercial agreement with CoreWeave. VAST's AI Operating System (AI OS) will be used as the foundation for the cloud provider's large-scale infrastructure. Both companies share a shared vision of building the next generation of data and compute architectures for artificial intelligence workloads.

articles.title: What Writer's AI Leaders Forum Revealed About Enterprise AI
articles.author: Steven Wolfe Pereira
articles.summary: At Writer's AI Leaders Forum, Brent Summers talked about his company-wide transformation using AI. He shared his journey with executives from e.l.f. Beauty, Marriott International, Blue Federal Credit Union, and several others. According to new research, only 15% of AI initiatives operate cross-functionally at scale to deliver enterprise value. The majority of enterprises today remain stuck in pilot purgatory.

articles.title: Letters to the editor, Nov. 8-9
articles.author: Texas Standard
articles.summary: AI is a threat to democracy, according to freshman student at UNT, who uses it for inspiration for essays, answers to homework or just for advice. He believes that more AI is updated, the more it causes a big threat to our democracy.

articles.title: CHAI: $48M/Year in Revenue After Funding Round by AMD and CoreWeave
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: CHAI has surpassed its 2025 revenue target two months ahead of schedule, reaching $48 million by the end of October. The company projects over $50 million in annual recurring revenue by year's end, representing an extraordinary 2.5x increase from $20 million at the beginning of 2025. CHAI was the first consumer AI product to reach 1 million users, leveraging the open-sourced GPT-J.

articles.title: CHAI: $48M/Year in Revenue After Funding Round by AMD and CoreWeave
articles.author: CHAI
articles.summary: CHAI has surpassed its 2025 revenue target two months ahead of schedule, reaching $48 million by the end of October. The company now projects over $50 million in annual recurring revenue by the year's end, representing an extraordinary 2.5x increase from $20 million at the beginning of 2025.

articles.title: Scientists create brain implant smaller than a grain of rice
articles.author: Indian Express
articles.summary: The implant is about the width of a human hair and works by moving the implant's material around the implant. It is attached to the implant via a wire. It works by stretching and contracting the wire around the device. It's about the size of a hair.

articles.title: AI Outshines Doctors in Empathy as Docs Go Robotic
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is better at empathetic communication than human healthcare professionals, according to Jeremy Howick. Empathy is a human quality that can't be replaced by technology. Doctors spend a third of their time on paperwork and electronic health records. They also follow pre-defined protocols and procedures. Burnout makes it harder for doctors to maintain empathy.

articles.title: To the editor: Comments on data centers shortsighted, ignore tax help
articles.author: Jim Stengle
articles.summary: Mr. Stengle, of Maumee, is retired from business and nonprofit leadership in northwest Ohio. He supports data center development in the area, because it would boost the economy and reduce the tax burden of the naysayers who oppose it. The proposed data center in Oregon is expected to provide approximately $20 million of additional annual tax revenue.

articles.title: Creator of much-hated AI-generated actor Tilly Norwood says dozens more are in the pipeline
articles.author: The Independent
articles.summary: Eline Van der Velden, creator of Tilly Norwood, said a few more AI characters are already in the works and more will be added in the near future. She also said that a few new AI characters will be created for the series.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on Amgen: 'They Have A Lot of Good Medicines'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Amgen Inc. (NASDAQ:AMGN) manufactures human therapeutics for cancer, cardiovascular, inflammatory, and bone disorders. Its main products include Enbrel, Prolia, Repatha, Otezla, and Kyprolis. Jim Cramer thinks Amgen needs to broaden its portfolio. The company had a good quarter last night, but the market didn't like its presentation on Monday and the stock sold off.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Says Companies Like Apple are 'Nation-States With Good Balance Sheets'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) sells smartphones, computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories under brands like iPhone, Mac, iPad, and Apple Watch. Jim Cramer said companies like Apple are 'nation-states' with good balance sheets. Cramer believes Apple will have a great quarter and its PE is probably going to be slightly above the market multiple.

articles.title: A researcher's view on using AI to become a better writer
articles.author: Stacker
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot that can help students improve their writing skills. Jennifer Meyer, an assistant professor at the University of Vienna in Austria, has been studying how AI bots can be used to improve student writing for several years. She believes students learn more when they write a first draft on their own. She is still testing how to use the technology effectively.

articles.title: Parents sue San Francisco-based OpenAI over son's death after conversation with chatbot
articles.author: Sooji Nam
articles.summary: Zane Shamblin, 23, from Texas, died by suicide this summer. His parents are suing OpenAI's ChatGPT and its maker, San Francisco-based OpenAI. They have filed seven lawsuits against OpenAI on Thursday. They met with California's Attorney General Rob Bonta on Friday.

articles.title: â€˜Pluribus' Includes 'Made By Humans' Disclaimer In Credits Amid AI Discourse
articles.summary: Vince Gilligan is setting an example about transparency with 'Pluribus' as artificial intelligence becomes less discernible and more prevalent in the modern world. He is setting the example with the transparency of his TV series. He has already done it with 'Pursuit'.

articles.title: Perplexity upgrades Comet to multitask across your tabs
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: Google embeds its Nano Banana AI image model into Search and NotebookLM, with Photos to follow soon.    .   "Nano Banana AI" is Google's AI-based image model. It can be used in both Search and in Photos.

articles.title: ChatGPT drove users to suicide, psychosis and financial ruin: California lawsuits
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, is facing seven lawsuits in California courts accusing it of releasing a psychologically manipulative and dangerously addictive artificial intelligence system that allegedly drove users to suicide, psychosis and financial ruin. The suits were filed by grieving people who were advised on how to tie a noose and how long they could live without air.

articles.title: Humans Only!
articles.author: New York Magazine
articles.summary: Comet is a web browser made by AI-search company Perplexity. You can download it and tell it to shop for you on Amazon using the command "Buy me on Amazon" after typing "After" in the address bar.   Ã‚

articles.title: Lawyer Up! K. Michelle Claps Back At "AI People" Allegedly Stealing Her Signature Voice, Plans To Sue
articles.author: The Shade Room
articles.summary: K. Michelle is calling out AI in music. She plans to sue an AI artist for allegedly using her voice and tones. Xania Monet is a chart-topping AI R&B singer who is accused of using AI in her music too.

articles.title: Pathology Models Evolve: Task-Specific to Foundation
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: In the era of precision oncology, computational pathology is emerging as a critical engine. Traditional computational pathology mainly relies on task-specific models. Foundation models (FMs) are trained via self-supervised learning on large-scale, multimodal, and multi-center pathology datasets. Pathology Image Foundation Models focus on extracting critical visual features from slide images and are applicable to tasks such as cancer type classification, tumor grading, and biomarker prediction. The PIMS Foundation Models are pre-trained on pathology images and text and support tasks like cross-modal retrieval and diagnostic report generation.

articles.title: Coca-Cola sparks backlash after new details about controversial holiday ad emerge: 'Wait a minute'
articles.author: Leslie Sattler
articles.summary: Coca-Cola used artificial intelligence to create a new holiday ad for its 2025 "Holidays Are Coming" campaign. The company's chief marketing officer, Manolo Arroyo, said the AI approach cut production time. This marks the second year Coke has used AI for its holiday campaign.

articles.title: Your News 'The Conversation' with Shawn Cunningham: Innovation of AI
articles.author: Shawn Cunningham
articles.summary: Shawn Cunningham is a correspondent for yourNEWS in Presque Isle, Maine. Christel Thorns is a Program Assistant II for the People Operations Division of the State of Colorado. Shawn launched a new digital media career after 22 years as a multiple award-winning television news producer/Anchor/Reporter.

articles.title: Canadian news publishers' lawsuit against OpenAI can proceed in Ontario, court rules
articles.author: Yvonne Lau
articles.summary: A lawsuit against ChatGPT maker OpenAI brought by a group of Canadian media companies can proceed in Ontario, a court ruled on Friday. Postmedia Network Inc., which publishes the Financial Post, CBC/Radio-Canada, The Globe and Mail, the Canadian Press and Toronto Star Newspapers Ltd. sued OpenAI in November 2024, accusing it of 'regularly breaching' copyright and online terms of use by scraping content from their websites to train its AI models and develop products. The court awarded the Canadian news media companies $260,000 in costs.

articles.title: Alight (ALIT) and IBM Expand Partnership to Boost Employee Benefits with AI
articles.author: Ali Ahmed
articles.summary: Alight, Inc. (NYSE:ALIT) is one of the 12 Best American Penny Stocks to Buy Right Now. On October 30, Alight announced an expanded partnership with IBM to combine IBM watsonx with its own offerings. IBM and Alight will set up a virtual AI innovation hub to speed up the redesigning of business processes and develop new AI solutions.

articles.title: TD Cowen and Canaccord Genuity Maintain Hold Ratings on Coty Inc. (COTY)
articles.author: Ali Ahmed
articles.summary: Coty Inc. (NYSE:COTY) is one of the 12 Best American Penny Stocks to Buy Right Now. TD Cowen and Canaccord Genuity have reiterated their Hold ratings on the company. Coty's CEO Sue Naby and CFO Laurent Mercier talked about their focus on high-end business areas like fragrance and skin care.

articles.title: Citizens Lifts Price Target for Taysha Gene Therapies (TSHA)
articles.author: Ali Ahmed
articles.summary: Citizens increased its price target on Taysha Gene Therapies, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSHA) from $6 to $8 and kept a Market Outperform rating. Citizens noted the finalization of the company's REVEAL pivotal trial for Rett syndrome treatment. The company plans to start the trial in Q4 2025.

articles.title: Needham and Oppenheimer Keep Buy Ratings on Aurora Innovation (AUR)
articles.author: Ali Ahmed
articles.summary: Aurora Innovation, Inc. (NASDAQ:AUR) is one of the 12 Best American Penny Stocks to Buy Right Now. Needham reaffirmed its Buy rating on AUR with a $13 price target on October 29. Oppenheimer analyst Colin Rusch also kept a Buy rating with a price target of $15. AUR is a self-driving technology company.

articles.title: You Can Now Interrupt ChatGPT as It Learns to Take Feedback on the Fly
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: OpenAI has added a new feature to ChatGPT that lets users interrupt the AI mid-response. Users can write context or corrections to a prompt without restarting, using the 'Update' button. The feature is aimed at those using GPT-5 Pro or Deep Research.

articles.title: From Manual Testing to AI Agents: A 90-Day Transformation Roadmap
articles.author: DEV Community
articles.summary: As AI agents become more sophisticated, QA teams have an opportunity to augment their capabilities and deliver higher quality software faster. This 90-day roadmap will guide you through a practical, phase-by-phase approach to integrating AI agents into your testing practice.

articles.title: SNU AI Tech Shrinks Chatbot Memory 3-4 Times
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Seoul National University College of Engineering has developed a new AI technology called "KVzip" that intelligently compresses the "conversation memory" of large language model (LLM-based chatbots used in long-context tasks such as extended dialogue and document summarization. The team's paper was selected as an Oral Presentation at NeurIPS 2025.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman Urges US to Expand Chips Act Tax Credit for AI Growth
articles.summary: OpenAI submitted a proposal to the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP) on how tax credits should be restructured. They want the 35% tax credit for semiconductor manufacturing to be expanded to include AI data centres, server production, and essential electrical grid.

articles.title: Thomas Cambell discusses AI
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: Thomas Campbell talks about the Larger Consciousness System (LCR) and artificial intelligence (AI) and consciousness. He explains the difference between an AI and a human being. He also explains how consciousness works in a computer the same way as in a human.

articles.title: ChatGPT, Gemini: Why OpenAI, Google and Perplexity are offering free AI in India?
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Millions of Indians are expected to receive a whole year of free access to ChatGPT's new, affordable 'Go' AI chatbot starting this week. Google and Perplexity AI released similar programs in the same way recently.   .

articles.title: Insurance Startup Uses AI To Offer Coverage in High-Risk California and Florida
articles.author: Snejana Farberov
articles.summary: Stand Insurance uses physics-based AI models to underwrite policies and create customized fire resilience plans for properties in California's wildfire-plagued areas. Last month, Stand raised $35 billion in a Series B funding round to expand coverage in hurricane-battered Florida. California has been in the throes of an insurance crisis since the deadly January wildfires in Los Angeles County.

articles.title: Coca-Cola AI Christmas Ad: Backlash & Criticism
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Coca-Cola's Christmas ad was created using artificial intelligence. It has sparked a debate about the ethics of AI in marketing. According to Morning Consult, 71% of consumers feel more connected to brands that demonstrate authenticity. Brands will need to demonstrate a commitment to ethical AI practices and transparency in their content creation processes.

articles.title: Infometry Unveils New Solutions And Services Powered By Snowflake Intelligence & Agentic AI
articles.summary: Infometry launches new AI solutions and services that leverage Snowflake Intelligence and Agentic AI. Infometry is a global leader in data analytics, AI, and cloud modernization solutions. Snowflake Migration and Modernization Services help customers transition from legacy on-prem and cloud data warehouse platforms into Snowflake's AI Data Cloud.

articles.title: The Boss Has a Message: Use AI or You're Fired
articles.author: Lindsay Ellis
articles.summary: Julie Sweet, the chief executive of consulting giant Accenture ACN 1.83%increase, recently delivered some tough news: Accenture is 'exiting' employees who aren't getting the hang of using AI at work. The firm has trained about 70% of its roughly 779,000 employees in generative artificial-intelligence fundamentals. Employees for whom 'reskilling' is not a viable path will be shown the door.

articles.title: The Boss Has a Message: Use AI or You're Fired
articles.author: Lindsay Ellis
articles.summary: Julie Sweet, the chief executive of Accenture, announced that 70% of her company's employees who don't use artificial intelligence are being let go. Many people are worried about being replaced by AI. Amazon.com announced layoffs last week that affected roughly 14,000 jobs, while Target shed 1,800 corporate roles.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman urges U.S. to expand Chips Act tax credit for AI growth
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: Altman's comment follows OpenAI Chief Global Affairs Officer Chris Lehane's letter to the White House on October 27th. Altman responded to Lehane with a statement on October 30th.    in response to the letter from Lehane. in which he said that OpenAI's chief executive officer, Altman, should resign.

articles.title: Malachy Clerkin: Gianni Infantino inventing the Fifa Peace Prize for Trump is humiliating all round
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: Gianni Infantino is the only man on the planet who makes you wish the AI overlords would just get on with it already. If they're coming for all the jobs, at least that means Fifa will at some stage be overseen by something other than this toadying grab-bag.

articles.title: Inside the race to train AI robots how to act human in the real world
articles.author: Billings Gazette
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence needs to learn how we physically move around in the real world, as it has mastered almost everything we do online, says India's top computer scientist.    i.e. how do we move around? i.y. for artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Friday charts: The photon economy
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: To learn how to navigate the physical world, robots need visual data to learn about the world around them. The data is provided by the robot's cameras and sensors. The robot uses this data to help it learn about its environment and navigate it. It also uses it to learn more about itself.

articles.title: You've just been laid off because of AI â€” here's what to do next

articles.summary: AI literacy is likely to become a baseline requirement for jobs in the future, according to Glassdoor's Chief Economist Daniel Zhao, who told CNBC Make It that AI literacy is going to be a requirement for all new jobs in future.  Â

articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Experts say India's vast, diverse and young user base makes it a key market for global AI expansion in the future. India has a vast and diverse population with a young and diverse and diverse user base. It has a large number of young and young potential users of AI.

articles.title: China's Moonshot AI launches new model lauded as No 1 among open-source systems
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Moonshot AI has released a new reasoning variant of its open-source Kimi K2 model. It has outperformed OpenAI's GPT-5 and Anthropic's model.   Â    .   in this regard, it has also outperformed Anthropic.

articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: Meta has a target of achieving superintelligence, a theoretical milestone where machines outthink humans, and it has doubled down on AI.    - Meta's CEO is a big fan of AI. It's possible that the company will achieve this goal in the near future.

articles.title: OpenAI faces 7 lawsuits claiming ChatGPT drove people to suicide, delusions
articles.author: Barbara Ortutay
articles.summary: OpenAI is facing seven lawsuits claiming ChatGPT drove people to suicide and harmful delusions even if they had no prior mental health issues. The suits are being filed on behalf of people who have committed suicide or suffered from mental health problems due to chatgpt.

articles.title: Does ChatGPT Write Me Better Than I Do?
articles.author: Keith Raffel
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI that can write more engagingly than humans. It can imitate the style of 50 major authors, including Stephen King, Margaret Atwood, Colson Whitehead, Maya Angelou, and Kazuo Ishiguro. ChatGPT's output was preferred for writing quality over that of the humans by both expert and lay readers.

articles.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Publishing Director Pushes Back At Square Enix's AI QA Plans
articles.author: Gamespot
articles.summary: Square Enix wants to drastically cut its Quality Assurance employees and use AI to handle 70% of its game QA and debugging. The company wants to establish a competitive advantage in game development. Michael Douse, the publishing director of Square Enix, disagrees with the company's plans.

articles.title: Got MBA or Computer Science? You're job-ready as AI and analytics take over India
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Got an MBA or Computer Science? You're jobready as AI and analytics take over India. You're ready to work in AI and Analytics as well as in Business Analytics and Business Analytics. You have to have a good knowledge of AI and Computer Science. You need to have an MBA.

articles.title: Main Street's job fears hit Wall Street as AI rally falters
articles.author: Detroit Free Press
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies released a report on Tuesday about the impact of artificial intelligence on the job market in the U.S. and the impact it's having on the jobs market in general.  iReporter Rachel Barber explains what we know now about AI and its impact on jobs.

articles.title: Data centers, and AI, are going to be big news topics

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is in the news a lot lately. Data centers have been around in Michigan for a few years, but the state's 60 facilities are still very small. They hold the massive computing capacity that allows for increased use of AI and other technology.

articles.title: The AI Conundrum: Soaring Demand, Strained Grids, and the Specter of a Market Bubble
articles.author: The Call
articles.summary: The march of Artificial Intelligence (AI) innovation is reshaping the global economic landscape. It is ushering in an era of unprecedented technological advancement. articles.title: People with ADHD, autism, dyslexia say AI agents are helping them succeed at work

articles.title: AI to play a central role in Ant Group's expanding healthcare plan
articles.author: China Daily
articles.summary: Han Xinyi, CEO of Ant Group, said artificial Intelligence will play a central role in the company's expanding healthcare strategy. Ant Group wants to make it easier for people to see a doctor and live a healthier life through its recent healthcare AI platform AQ.

articles.title: Man goes to Japan for Google project, leaves 10-year-old job toâ€¦
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Jad Tarifi left Google to start over in Japan. He is now the founder and CEO of robotics-focused AI startup Integral AI. Business Insider published an essay by Tarifi explaining why he left Google. He left to pursue a vision that might not fit with Google's advertising model.

articles.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools
articles.author: Cathy Bussewitz
articles.summary: Judges around the world are dealing with legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors. French data scientist and lawyer, Damien Charlotin, catalogued at least 490 court filings in the past six months that contained 'hallucinations,' which are AI responses that contain false or misleading information. Maria Flynn, CEO of Jobs for the Future, recommends checking the accuracy of what AI generates.

articles.title: Considering AI's Rapid Growth: Two Years Later
articles.summary: By the end of 2026, AI will be built into most office and creative software. Video generation will probably reach commercial quality. Personal tutoring systems will start appearing in schools. AI can now generate documents, charts, or lesson plans with few errors and can take direction from voice or uploaded files.
